value.0: Greetings, dreamer. What do you seek?

The Dreaming is the collective representation of all dreams- past, present and future. It is here that the imagination of the world comes to life. Some of the creatures you will see are the result of those dreams, and every inch of the Silver Path, from the Spawning Fields to the Nightmare Realms, has been hammered out by travelers who sought the source of their inspiration.
This is the wellspring of all imagination, yes, but it is an ever-flowing circle. As we inspire, so the dreamers grant us more life, more strength.
It can be, yes. There are places where the nightmares of the world lurk. The Silver Path is the safest road to tread, for it is stable. The rest of the Dreaming is not.
There are many paths, but only one Silver Path. It is easily recognizable to travelers.
Those who can enter the Dreaming may also use the Silver Path. A guide would be recommended, for there are dangers even on the Path.

Yes. And not all dreams are gentle. As with the Waking World, danger comes in many guises. Take care, dreamer, and do not trust everything you see. There is only one law in the Dreaming and that is the Dreaming itself. It knows no logic.
The Dreaming knows no master.
Dame Solange of the house Scathach is responsible for the land you now stand upon, yes, but she claims no rulership of it.

...I would not say that. There is an art to taming the Dreaming to one's whims, and those who have not the art are usually consumed by the Dreaming, for it rejects all rulership, save that of the sidhe.
The sidhe. They are the ruling class of the fae, the nobles. Dame Solange is of their kith.

Kith is what the fae itself is. There are many who still roam the Waking World. The sidhe left years ago for their home of Arcadia. The kiths you are most likely to meet are the boggan, eshu, nocker, redcap, pooka, satyr, sluagh and troll. Each kith has its' own way of thinking, its' own traditions and its' own source of origin.
Alas, they are not what once they were. The Changeling Way is how they survive now, dreamer. Fae souls incarnated in mortal bodies to withstand the growing disbelief in the world.
Yes. The mortal shell is what provides them their safe haven, save what they find here in the Dreaming.
There is no magical path to grant one a fae soul. One either is or is not a changeling.
Mortals are the source of all dreams. How could the fae despise that which gives them Glamour?

Glamour is the very stuff dreams are made of. It is the fuel for a fae's magics, and what they need to keep their souls alive. Without Glamour, a fae will forget who and what they are and become solely mortal.

Every fae lives in terror of the day they no longer recall their connection to the Dreaming. They will do anything to avoid that end, and as the world becomes further from the idea of magic and wonder, Glamour wanes. It has not yet become Winter, but the Autumn leaves are beginning to show.

The time when Glamour flowed freely and dreams were as tangible as the grass beneath your feets was the Summer of our time. Now, as science grows in strength and people hold to the ideals of the Church, the leaves of Glamour are turning, and we approach the Autumn. The Winter will be the time of no Glamour, when magic dies and the fae find themselves bereft of all sanctuary.
By inspiring mortals, encouraging dreams and seeking the wonder in every day, the fae seek to reverse the tides and bring the Summer back.
Only time will tell, dreamer. Your very presence here gives me great hope that the leaves will cease falling and the chill of encroaching Winter will never become the blizzard we fear.
Information. This is the Dreaming, but... What does that mean precisely?
So this is where inspiration comes from?
Oh... Well, the capy... thing said this was a dangerous place.
There's only one path?
Can anyone use it?
What kind of dangers? The... nightmares you mentioned?
Well... Thank you then. I'll be careful.
...who rules here?
...the sign said...
So... Anyone can rule here?
What's a she?
Okay, what's a kith?
...that's a lot of fae.
So they're ...fae souls in human bodies?
How does someone become a fae?
...do the fae hate mortals for what they have to do to survive?
...Glamour? What's that?
...oh. That sounds bad.
...winter? What does that mean? Fae fear the changing of the seasons?
...that sounds very bad. Are they doing anything to stop it?
...will they succeed?
...well... Thank you then.
